classes module

class classes.Course(course_id: str, course_name: str, instructor: Instructor, enrolled_students: list)[source]

Bases: object

A class representing a Course.

Parameters:

  • course_id (str) – The unique identifier for the course.

  • course_name (str) – The name of the course.

  • instructor (Instructor) – The instructor teaching the course.

  • enrolled_students (list) – A list of students enrolled in the course.

add_student(student)[source]

Add a student to the course and update the database.

Parameters:

student (Student) – The student to enroll in the course.

static deserialize(data, instructors, students)[source]

Deserialize a dictionary into a Course object.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – A dictionary containing the course’s details.

  • instructors (dict) – A dictionary of instructors with instructor IDs as keys.

  • students (dict) – A dictionary of students with student IDs as keys.

Returns:

A new instance of the Course class.

Return type:

Course

edit_in_db()[source]

Update the course’s details in the database.

This method updates the course’s record in the Courses table.

get_course_id()[source]

Get the course ID.

Returns:

The unique course ID.

Return type:

str

Get the course name.

Returns:

The name of the course.

Return type:

str

get_enrolled_students()[source]

Get the list of enrolled students.

Returns:

A list of students enrolled in the course.

Return type:

list

get_instructor()[source]

Get the instructor of the course.

Returns:

The instructor assigned to the course.

Return type:

Instructor

save_to_db()[source]

Save the course’s details to the database.

This method inserts or replaces the course’s record in the Courses table.

serialize()[source]

Serialize the course object to a dictionary.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the course’s details, including the instructor ID and enrolled students.

Return type:

dict

set_course_id(course_id)[source]

Set the course ID.

Parameters:

course_id (str) – The new course ID.

Set the course name.

Parameters:

course_name (str) – The new course name.

set_enrolled_students(enrolled_students)[source]

Set the list of enrolled students.

Parameters:

enrolled_students (list) – A new list of students to enroll.

set_instructor(instructor)[source]

Set the instructor for the course.

Parameters:

instructor (Instructor) – The new instructor for the course.

class classes.Instructor(name: str, age: int, _email: str, instructor_id: str, assigned_courses: list)[source]

Bases: Person

A class representing an Instructor, which is a subclass of Person.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the instructor.

  • age (int) – The age of the instructor.

  • _email (str) – The email address of the instructor (inherited from Person).

  • instructor_id (str) – The unique ID of the instructor.

  • assigned_courses (list) – A list of courses assigned to the instructor.

assign_course(course)[source]

Assign a course to the instructor and save it to the database.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course to assign.

static deserialize(data, courses)[source]

Deserialize a dictionary into an Instructor object.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – A dictionary containing the instructor’s details.

  • courses (dict) – A dictionary of course objects with course IDs as keys.

Returns:

A new instance of the Instructor class.

Return type:

Instructor

edit_in_db()[source]

Update the instructor’s details in the database.

This method updates the instructor’s record in the Instructors table.

Returns:

handle_course_assignment()[source]

Save the instructor’s course assignments to the database.

This method inserts or replaces records in the Assignments table for the instructor’s assigned courses.

save_to_db()[source]

Save the instructor’s details to the database.

This method inserts or replaces the instructor’s record in the Instructors table.

serialize()[source]

Serialize the instructor object to a dictionary.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the instructor’s details, including assigned courses.

Return type:

dict

instructor_id (str) – The new instructor ID.

class classes.Person(name: str, age: int, _email: str)[source]

Bases: object

A class representing a Person.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the person.

  • age (int) – The age of the person.

  • _email (str) – The email address of the person (treated as a protected attribute).

class classes.Student(name: str, age: int, _email: str, student_id: str, registered_courses: list)[source]

Bases: Person

A class representing a Student, which is a subclass of Person.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the student.

  • age (int) – The age of the student.

  • _email (str) – The email address of the student (inherited from Person).

  • student_id (str) – The unique student ID.

  • registered_courses (list) – A list of registered courses for the student.

static deserialize(data, courses)[source]

Deserialize a dictionary into a Student object.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – A dictionary containing the student’s details.

  • courses (dict) – A dictionary of course objects with course IDs as keys.

Returns:

A new instance of the Student class.

Return type:

Student

edit_in_db()[source]

Update the student’s details in the database.

This method updates the student’s record in the Students table.

handle_course_enrollment()[source]

Save the student’s course enrollments to the database.

This method inserts or replaces records in the Enrollments table for the student’s registered courses.

register_course(course)[source]

Register a new course for the student.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course to be added.

save_to_db()[source]

Save the student’s details to the database.

This method inserts or replaces the student’s record in the Students table.

dict
